taxonomicnotes: Hamilton (1822) described Ophiocephalus marulius from river Ganges, which is now placed in the genus Channa. The group has been studied recently by Li et al. (2006). As presently understood, Channa marulius is a species complex and further taxonomic work is required.
rationale: Channa marulius is a widespread species with no known major threats and hence is assessed as Least Concern. Further captive breeding programmes for commercial purposes are under way.
evaluator: Rema Devi, K.R., Arunachalam, M., Dahanukar, N., Daniel, B.A., Datta, N.C., Vishwanath, W., Molur, S., Britz, R., Dey, S.C. & Jha, B.R.
